lead_paragraph: Expensive premiums and high deductibles for policies sold under the Affordable Care Act make tax penalties the preferred option for some resisters.

headline.print_headline: Many Holdouts Roll the Dice and Pay I.R.S., Not an Insurer
headline.main: Many See I.R.S. Penalties as More Affordable Than Insurance

snippet: Expensive premiums and high deductibles for policies sold under the Affordable Care Act make tax penalties the preferred option for some resisters.
abstract: Many of over 10 million Americans who are eligible to buy health insurance through Affordable Care Act's insurance exchanges have yet to make commitment, believing it cheaper to pay government fine than to pay for coverage; while number of uninsured has continued to drop, which suggests threat of fine has been sufficient for some, healthy number of holdouts underscores concerns in insurance industry over financial viability of exchanges over time.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
